Create a multi-functional space: Incorporate a Murphy bed, foldable table, and built-in storage units to maximize the of the space.
Use natural materials: Use reclaimed wood, bamboo, and other sustainable materials to create a rustic and eco-friendly look.
Add a living wall: Incorporate a vertical garden or living wall to bring greenery into the space and add a pop of color.
Utilize energy-efficient appliances: Choose small, energy-efficient appliances such as a mini fridge, stove, and water heater to conserve space and reduce energy consumption.
Use a minimalist design: Keep the design simple and clean to avoid clutter and create a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere.
